newsitem.title: USA: NYMEX electric futures mostly higher in thin trade.
newsitem.headline: NYMEX electric futures mostly higher in thin trade.

text.p: NYMEX electricity futures ended mixed in thin trade with little news to move the market and mild temperatures through much of the country, industry sources said.
"There was a lot of over the counter activity and people were really wrapped up with that, which can sometimes push up futures volumes but that wasn't the case today," said one power futures broker.
October California Oregon Border (COB) ended up eight cents at $15.50 after trade in a range of $15.40-15.70, while November ended steady at $16.40 per megawatt hour (MWh).
Remaining COB deferreds settled between two and 10 cents higher.
October Palo Verde (PV) closed down five cents at $16.05 after trading as high as $16.15, while November was steady at $15.05.
Remaining PV deferreds finished up between five and 10 cents, with the exception of October, 1997 which closed up 50 cents at $16.50 per MWh.
-- Chris Reese, New York Power Desk 212-859-1627
